result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwon D Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment.

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment.

No firearms; weapons.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
No contact with victim, Mary A. without prior court approval.

Successfully complete "Batterers Intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
Attend and complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution is set at zero.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt: Order Denying Sentence Adjustment Request, filed and disbursed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, for review. jbs
on count one.  Defendant's address:  Antwon Williams Racine County Jail, 717 Wisconsin Avenue, Racine, WI  53403.

Defendant Antwon D Williams in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Antwon D Williams in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.   mld

Defendant Antwon D Williams in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.  Court ordered case adjourned for probation review hearing in Branch 4.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 02-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Due to the unavailability of the court on 10-17-2014, Probation Review Heairng rescheduled to 11-14-2014 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4.    mld

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNTS #2 and #3 are dismissed and read-in for the purposes of sentencing.

 AS TO COUNT #1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2014CF217), with credit for 53 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:  
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 45 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Mary A. 
   without prior court approval. 
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.  
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
   --- Costs also apply to count #1.  
* Restitution is set at zero.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 10-17-2014 AT 1:30 PM.   
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.   mld

Defendant Antwon D Williams in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Antwon D Williams in custody.  Ryan T Sanson, appearing for Molly Schmidt, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant has a pending case in Branch 4; State's motion for joinder granted by the Court.  Defense may argue the joinder on the next court date.
